title: Thai beef salad

ingredients.content: 400 g beef fillet, cut into thin strips (6 x 1 cm)
¼ cabbage (approx. 330 g), cut into pieces
90 g slivered almonds, raw or toasted
100 g tatsoi or fresh baby spinach leaves
long red chilli, finely sliced, for garnishing (optional)

preparations.content: Place garlic and ginger into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add fish sauce, rice wine vinegar and sesame oil and combine <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer marinade into a ceramic or glass bowl. Place bowl with marinated onto mixing bowl lid and weigh beef into it. Combine well, then cover with plastic wrap and set aside in the refrigerator to marinate for 1 hour.
Insert Varoma tray and line with a piece of wet and well-wrung baking paper. Place marinated beef onto baking paper and set Varoma aside.

Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and cook <b>6 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Stir beef with spatula to ensure even cooking, then secure Varoma lid and cook for a further <b>4 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Stir beef again with spatula, secure Varoma lid and cook for a further <b>1-2 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, or until beef is cooked. Transfer beef into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place ginger into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add all remaining dressing ingredients and mix <b>6 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer dressing into a serving jug and set aside until ready to use.
Place cabbage and onion into mixing bowl and chop <b>4-5 sec/speed 4<b>, or until evenly chopped. Transfer into a large serving bowl and set aside.

Place serving bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh almonds and tatsoi or baby spinach into it. Toss through reserved dressing. Top salad with beef fillet, garnish with finely sliced red chilli (optional) and lime cheeks, then serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Using tamari instead of soy sauce will make this a gluten free recipe.
